clinical_study.brief_title: Measurement of Spinal Kinematics During Various Movements
clinical_study.official_title: Differences in Spinal Kinematics During Various Activities Between Asymptomatic Subjects and Patients With Chronic Low Back Pain

brief_summary.textblock: Participants will perform movements while receiving different visual cues. Spinal kinematics will be measured during these movements and compared between asymptomatic and CLBP participants. Participants will come for a unique session.

primary_outcome.description: Spinal kinematics will be measured at the lumbar and thoracic spine in degrees

arm_group.description: All CLBP patients should present with non-specific low back pain (pain from lower ribs to gluteal folds) for more than 3 months.

Asymptomatic participants should have had no history of LBP requiring medical attention during the last two years and no other concomitant pain or condition that could compromise the evaluation of lumbar kinematics.

intervention.description: Participants will be asked to move following cues displayed on a screen in front of them.

study_pop.textblock:
CLBP patients will be recruited through a multimodal rehabilitation program at Lausanne University Hospital, medical doctors or physiotherapists' consultations.
Healthy controls will be a convenience sample recruited using flyers and emails, notably posted at the Lausanne University Hospital, the University of Health Professions in Lausanne (HESAV) and at the University of Lausanne.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Participants should have a sufficient French level to understand the instructions for the tests, the information sheet, the consent form.
All CLBP patients should present with non-specific low back pain (pain from lower ribs to gluteal folds) for more than 3 months.
Asymptomatic participants should have had no history of LBP requiring medical attention during the last two years and no other concomitant pain or condition that could compromise the evaluation of lumbar kinematics.
Exclusion Criteria:
General exclusion criteria will be pregnancy, skin allergy to tape and a body mass index (BMI) that is above 32, since BMI has been suggested to influence lumbar kinematics and may provide supplementary difficulties to find the bony landmarks (Mitchell et al. 2008).
Furthermore, to be invited to the study, patients should not have any sign of specific low back pain such as the presence of infection, rheumatological or neurological diseases, spinal fractures, any known important spinal deformities, previous back surgery that limits spinal mobility, tumours, high level of pain at the time of experiment that prevents repeated movements (severity and irritability), or other concomitant pain or condition that could compromise the evaluation of spinal kinematics.
